intro: Viola odorata f. lilacina, commonly known as the lilac-flowered violet, is a cultivar of the common violet, characterized by its pale lilac-colored flowers. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is native to Europe, particularly the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with heart-shaped, velvety leaves and fragrant, showy blooms that appear in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden borders and woodland gardens.
